intro: Vincetoxicum nipponicum, commonly known as Japanese agrimony, is a flowering plant native to Japan and parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its stems are often woody and covered in fine hairs. Vincetoxicum nipponicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
